item.title: About me
item.description: Hi, I’m Yoric, aka David Teller, I’m a Jack of all Threads at Mozilla and I produce code, speed, programming languages and performance data for a living. I’ve been spotted spending time on the SpiderMonkey JavaScript Virtual Machine; a micro-kernel; a next-gen browser engine; a few compilers; static analyzers; a few eBook readers; a programming language designed for multi-tiered web applications and services whose components distrust each other; a programming language designed for always-on, fault-tolerant, reboot-tolerant, hardware-replacement-tolerant, power-limited IoT applications; IoT for the disabled; IoT snooping countermeasure experiment; pedagogic robots; open-source mentoring; university teaching; high-school teaching; academic research; also, backpacking through exotic countries; … You can find my latest resume here.
